title: Lima Just For Foodies
description: Celebrated as South America’s culinary capital, there’s no better place to sample Peruvian cuisine than Lima. Sample the best of capital’s specialities on a small-group food tour limited to only six people. You’ll overcome the language barrier and get off the beaten path as you feast on multiple courses.
all_descriptions: Celebrated as South America’s culinary capital, there’s no better place to sample Peruvian cuisine than Lima. Sample the best of capital’s specialities on a small-group food tour limited to only six people. You’ll overcome the language barrier and get off the beaten path as you feast on multiple courses.

ItineraryThere’s no better way to visit a city than by exploring its market and trying the food with the locals who know it best. Lima Tasty Tours invites guests to explore a neighborhood off the beaten track, hidden gems of the city and enjoy the best street food with your Peruvian foodie guide. Join us as we reveal the secrets of one of the greatest indoor food markets in Peru. And we are always fine tuning our tour to make your experience tastier.

We guarantee you won’t find a food tour experience in Lima like this!

*Please note the tour includes many non-vegetarians samples.
Biblioteca Municipal, Parque Municipal, Barranco 15063, PeruAt the gate of Biblioteca (library) in the main square of Barranco, Barranco 15063.
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.
provider:

LizaKline
San Diego, CA130 contributions

All we had was fruit

Sep 2025 • Family
After weeks of communication to tailor a personalized private food tour we finally made it to Lima and met with our guide!

Our 2 guides were great, informative and personable. They were very proud of Peru and their unique foods.

My issue is all we were given to try were the fruits of the market and a papas relleno. Although we enjoyed all the new and exotic fruits we tried we were promised we were going to try other street foods as we discussed in the planning phase. We didn’t eat much at breakfast because we were told we would be full with all the things we’d get to try. We were even asked if there were any food allergies on our release form.

We paid $70 for a 3 hour tour which included walking around Barranco district which was a highlight! The street art, Bridge of Sighs and coastline views of Lima were gorgeous. And our brief tuk tuk ride to get to the market was fun. The tour was good but I feel we should have just joined one of their regular food tours and get to try more foods and pay less than a private tour.
Written October 1, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

This tour was our highlight in Lima! Our guide Arturo knows all about food, Lima and Peru in general. We really enjoyed all the different fruits and tasted, a lot of things we had never heard about!

reviews.text: After weeks of communication to tailor a personalized private food tour we finally made it to Lima and met with our guide!Our 2 guides were great, informative and personable.  They were very proud of Peru and their unique foods.My issue is all we were given to try were the fruits of the market and a papas relleno.  Although we enjoyed all the new and exotic fruits we tried we were promised we were going to try other street foods as we discussed in the planning phase. We didn’t eat much at breakfast because we were told we would be full with all the things we’d get to try.  We were even asked if there were any food allergies on our release form.We paid $70 for a 3 hour tour which included walking around Barranco district which was a highlight!  The street art, Bridge of Sighs and coastline views of Lima were gorgeous.  And our brief tuk tuk ride to get to the market was fun.  The tour was good but I feel we should have just joined one of their regular food tours and get to try more foods and pay less than a private tour.
